mathematical_evidence: Lower breakpoint: 37.7°F (95% CI: [36.7°F, 38.7°F]), Upper breakpoint: 59.3°F (95% CI: [58.2°F, 59.3°F])
ERCO elasticity = 0.909 (2.0× higher than least sensitive region)
Summer demand 26.5% higher than minimum season (p<1.73e-8)
statistical_test: ANOVA with Tukey HSD post-hoc test

mathematical_evidence: Random Forest R² = 0.997 (93.1% improvement over linear model)
Each 1°F deviation from optimal temperature increases demand by 2.03%, rising to 3.06% for extreme deviations (>30°F)
